Class HumanPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • Player
      • HumanPlayer
  • public class HumanPlayer
extends Player
    This class represents a type of player, a human player.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HumanPlayer

        public HumanPlayer​(Coordinate playerCoords,
                   java.util.ArrayList<Command> validCommandsArray)
        The constructor initialises a human player with the coordinate they are in and the array of commands that they accept
        Parameters:
        playerCoords - Coordinate which represents the player's coordinate
        validCommandsArray - ArrayList of Commands which contains the commands this player accepts

    • Method Detail

      • nextAction

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> nextAction()
        Implementation of the abstract method which is how a human player does an action. It asks for a user input from the console and loops through each of the commands the player has and checks whether it has the correct command name and arguments.
        Specified by:
        nextAction in class Player
        Returns:
        List of strings which contains the command name and its arguments that the player made.

      • setNextAction

        public void setNextAction​(java.lang.String nextAction)

      • handleCommandCallback

        public void handleCommandCallback​(java.lang.String commandName,
                                  java.lang.String returnVal)
        Implementation of the abstract method which is how a human player deals with the return of an action. The human just prints the returnVal to the console for the user to see.
        Specified by:
        handleCommandCallback in class Player
        Parameters:
        commandName - String containing the command name the player made
        returnVal - String containing the return value of the command the player has called

      • isHuman

        public boolean isHuman()
        Implementation of the abstract method which is whether the player is human or not, returns true.
        Specified by:
        isHuman in class Player
        Returns:
        boolean true

      • getPlayerChar

        public char getPlayerChar()
        Implementation of the abstract method which is to get the player's character
        Specified by:
        getPlayerChar in class Player
        Returns:
        character 'P'
